title: Newton's Method
text: The formula for Newton's Method is given by $$x_n+1=x_n-\frac{f{\left(x_n\right)}}{\operatorname{f'}\left(x_n\right)}$$. Remember that Newton's method is used to converge on roots of f(x). If you applied it to f'(x) instead, it would therefore find where $$f'(x)=0$$, or the local extrema.
